sent_vocabs: sapient - wise, or attempting to appear wise
equivocate - use ambiguous language to conceal the truth or avoid commitment
arduous - involving or requiring strenuous effort; difficult and tiring
feckless - lacking initiative or strength of character; irresponsible
quixotic - exceedingly idealistic; unrealistic and impractical
pernicious - having a harmful effect, especially in a gradual or subtle way
querulous - complaining in a petulant or whining manner
paradigm - a typical example or pattern of something
arcane - understood by few; mysterious or secret
enigmatic - difficult to interpret or understand; mysterious
platitude - a remark or statement that is unoriginal, esp. one uttered as if it were fresh or profound
jettison - throw or drop from an aircraft or ship
sagacious - having or showing keen mental discernment and good judgment
welter - a confused mass of things
ostensible - stated or appearing to be true, but not necessarily so
garrulous - excessively talkative, especially on trivial matters
obfuscate - to deliberately make something unclear or difficult to understand
sent_phrases: Between a rock and a hard place
In the blink of an eye
Cross that bridge when you come to it
Light at the end of the tunnel
The ball is in your court
Let the cat out of the bag
